1.name: Entrance to a Hunting Village
desc: "   You come upon the entrance to a hunting village. To the west you see vast
fields of grass. You are standing on a dirt path which leads to various
huts. Blood stains the ground at your feet and looks as though creatures
have been dragged to the south. A cool breeze from the north brings
the smell of sweet perfume.

2.name: An intersection in the path
desc: "   You have come upon the intersection of four dirt paths. Small
buildings can be seen in all directions. The sound of barking
dogs echo from the south.

3.name: Along a dirt path
desc: "   The path  continues north to the base of two enormous trees. To the west the path
continues to an intersection.

4.name: Entrance to a Hunting Village
desc: "   You come upon the entrance to a hunting village. A clear path has been
swept to the west, leading to a small straw hut. The eastern path
leads to the bottom of two enormous trees. In the distance to the south
you can hear dogs barking.

5.name: The Merchant's Hut
desc: "   This hut has been placed here temporarily. Straw was used to line the
ceiling and walls, barely enough to keep out the rain. The room has
a pleasant odour of expensive perfume, sprayed recently enough to
tickle your senses.

6.name: The Skinning Post
desc: "   Several animal carcuses dangle by ropes from the ceiling. Blood and
entrails spill at your feet. This is where the caught animals are
skinned and gutted by one lucky hunter. A large rock has been smoothed
to act as a table. The smell of burnt food seeps in from the south.
"   Someone has spend a great amount of time chiseling this large
stone into the shape of a box. It acts as an adequate skinning table.
The top and most of the sides are permanently stained with blood.
"   Dripping blood onto the floor, this large slab of meat is rather
disturbing. You are unable to tell what kind of animal it formerly
was but expect that it was probably a deer or elk. Flies have taken
the liberty to lay eggs in and feed on its remains.

7.name: Bottom of a Tree House
desc: "   You find yourself under the shade of two huge trees. A log treehouse
has been built several meters up, held by their enormous branches.
Dispite the stong wind atop their canopy, the trees remain still.

8.name: Along a dirt path
desc: "   The path continues south towards the barking of dogs. To the north
you spot a four way intersection. A large sturdy hut lies to your
east.

9.name: The Hunters Quarters
desc: "   This room is cold and dirty. It doesn't seem to have been cleaned
in years. Bits of food and spilt liquids line the floor. Several
rock piles have been flattened and covered with animal skins to
act as beds.

10.name: The Hunters Quarters
desc: This section of the quarters is being used as storage for hunting
equipment. Several broken weapons have been thrown on the floor,
many of them covered with dried blood. A target for dagger practice
hangs from the south wall. From the looks of the target, whoever is
throwing, rarely misses.

11.name: Along a dirt path
desc: "   Smoke bellows softly from a chimney of the hut to your west. Often
you catch the smell of burning food. A dirt path continues north
and south.

12.name: The Camp Kitchen
desc: "   The stench of burnt flesh and dried blood is unbearable! Most
of the meat here looks to have gone bad. A fat cook is intend on
cooking it anyways. A large black pot boils in a fireplace to the
rear of the room. You sure are glad that you packed your lunch
today.
This is a large black pot. The cook is intent on throwing
pieces of rotten meat and any other thing he can fit in here
Often the pot boils over, spilling some of the mixture into
the fireplace.
This is a large stone fireplace with the chimney disappearing
through the ceiling. The fire inside boils a large black pot.

13.name: Along a dirt path
desc: "   Upon entering this portion of the dirt path you come upon two small
structures. West consists of an overhead shelter and a small fenced
enclosure. You can hear loud barking from a dog cage to the east.
Luckily, someone has closed the cage to prevent the dogs from escaping.

14.name: The Dog Cage
desc: "   The rusty dog cage is barely high enough for you to stand in. A
large metal bowl lies empty in the far corner. Several holes
have been dug in the dirt throughout the pen, luckily the wire
fence has been buried deep enough to contain the animals. You
can tell that these dogs haven't been fed in quite some time.
"   From the shine on the metal you can tell that this is probably a
new bowl. It seems that some animal has taken the liberty to chew it
out of shape and puncture it with tooth holes. Could something really
be that hungry?

15.name: The Horse Stables
desc: "   The horse stable consists of a small fenced area with a leaky
roof to protect the animals during harsh weather. To the west
the fence opens into a small grassy field. A small bail of hay
and a water trough are placed near the eastern fencing.
"   This is a rather poorly constructed wooden rectangle. The brown
mirky water is cool to the touch but has a rather unpleasant smell.
You decide to leave the trough alone expecting it to break at any
time.
The bail consists of various grasses compacted and inter-twined to
make a large ball. Small bugs scurry in and out of the bail feeding
on its contents.

16.name: In A Treehouse
desc: "   This is a finely polished room with expensive furniture. A huge
oak bed lies against the northern wall, it is covered with several
fine furs. A solid ladder leads down to the base of the tree.
Above, a large hatch in the ceiling is engraved with the word
'Lookout'.

17.name: In a Lookout
desc: "   Wow! From this place you can see for miles in every direction but south.
This is probably where the Chief Hunter sits when deciding which
area to hunt. Turning to your west you can see the east gates of
Midgard. The eastern view allows you to look atop dark pine forests
leading to the steep mountain slopes. To the north you see miles
of grass blowing in the wind. Your view to the south is impeded by
tree branches.

18.name: A Grazing Field
desc: "   This field allows the horses some space for movement when they
are not in use. A fence has been carefully constructed to ensure
none escape.

19.name: A Trail around A Hunting Village
desc: "   You are on a well beaten trail leading through the tall thick
grass surrounding you. The trail circles a small collection of
huts and cabins. The sound of barking dogs echoes in the distance.
Smoke from one hut bellows far into the sky. An entrance to the
village leads to the south.

20.name: A Trail around A Hunting Village
desc: "   You are on a well beaten trail leading through the tall thick
grass surrounding you. The trail circles a small collection of
huts and cabins. The sound of barking dogs echoes in the distance.
